data.title: Shroud rendering glitches
data.body:
I get this on "ore lord" in the top left corner:
![shroudglitch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/6764495/ec11fbc6-cfb1-11e4-9c64-edba57c31a1d.png)

data.title: New D2k maps
data.body:
There are quite few distributed maps for the D2k mod. Not too many on the resource site, either, and honestly, searching for maps for a specific mod there is still impossible.
So with OpenRA now having a map importer for D2k maps, I suggest we boost the arsenal a bit for the next playtest (then some more for the release).
How about we start by importing some of the original skirmish maps?
I've generated previews of all 36 original skirmish maps and uploaded an archive [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/qcj3ktwmmadepl5/Showcase.rar?dl=0). ~~The file names tell you how many players the map has.~~
I'd like to hear opinions about the maps and suggestions which to start with.

Note: some maps have visual glitches because I generated all previews using the same tileset, but they should still give you a pretty good idea of the terrain layout.

Original official skirmish maps:
- [ ] 2PLAY1 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY2 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY3 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY4 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY5 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY6 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY7 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY8 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY9 - preview pending; Note: import results in broken tiles due to missing tiles from the BLOXBGBS tileset
- [ ] 2PLAY10 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY11 - preview pending
- [ ] 2PLAY12 - [preview](http://i.imgur.com/jToXtuV.jpg); [.oramap file](https://www.dropbox.com/s/it2xwrshjji8fko/2PLAY12.oramap?dl=0); Note: The map has 8 starting locations, so I've left all of them. I reduced the wormspawners though, to account for our more serious worms
- [ ] 2PLAY13 - preview pending; Note: import results in broken tiles due to issues with out version of the BLOXXMAS tileset and/or the importer's interaction with it
- [ ] 2PLAY14 - preview pending; Note: import results in broken tiles due to missing tiles from the BLOXBGBS tileset
- [ ] 3PLAY1 - preview pending
- [ ] 4PLAY1 - preview pending
- [ ] 4PLAY2 - preview pending
- [ ] 4PLAY3 - preview pending

data.title: Updated SharpFont to 3.0.0, adjusted font rendering code for new fixed-point types
data.body:
Tested, main menu seems to be rendering fonts just fine.

If you'd prefer the fetch-thirdparty-deps scripts to be organized slightly differently, let me know. I just went with the minimal number of lines I'd have to change.

I'm also using the MSVC10 x86 version of freetype6.dll, if you wanted a different one also let me know.

data.title: Added raycaster and fixed neutrino bullets.
data.body:
Closes #7675, #5294.

Provides a base for #4458.
EDIT: Also provides a base for #6000, #7077 and the corresponding sandworm-cliff issue.

data.title: Fix d2k faction logos being visible behind radar on narrow maps
data.body: Fixes #7688

data.title: Replaced Mono.Nat with Open.NAT
data.body:
as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7140. I found a way to get us async support without raising the .NET version requirement.

~~I have some trouble getting this to work. See https://github.com/lontivero/Open.NAT/issues/20. This is the first time I experiment with AsyncTasks so I may be doing this wrong or Open.NAT is not yet ready for productive use with FRITZ!Box (a popular router in Germany).~~ Fixed.

data.title: Corrected the NSIS Setup.exe renaming in the last AppVeyor step
data.body: Backslash instead of slash and using absolute paths prefixed with %APPVEYOR_BUILD_FOLDER%.

data.title: Add new labels for the issue tracker
data.body:
Here are two suggestions that might be useful:
**1.** Add an "Art"/"Artwork" label. Not to be confused with the "UI" label. This can be useful in cases like "rework a stealth effect", "create a new projectile effect", "create a new contrail effect", "change unit build palette image", etc.
**2.** Add "Windows"/"Linux"/"MacOS" labels. We get quite a few OS-specific issues, so those would be useful.

data.title: D2k visual polish
data.body:
Here are a few artwork-related things that would be nice to see fixed:
- [x] **1.** Missile tank missiles should have "contrails" as seen [here](http://media.moddb.com/images/games/1/14/13377/big-battle.jpg)
- [x] **2.** Quad (and infantry) missiles should have contrails, as seen [here](http://i.imgur.com/f1h5kp3.png) and [here](http://i.imgur.com/ZjLNtM1.png). Currently the quad's missiles have no contrail, and the trooper's missiles use the RA contrail.
- [x] **3.** Deviator tank missiles should not cause explosions, but rather form a gas cloud, as barely seen [here](http://i.imgur.com/aYiIV.jpg) in the upper right corner. Also their contrail looks better in the original.
- [ ] **4.** Dune 2000 used an interesting-looking stealth effect that we don't have. Would be nice to have something that resembles it.
- [ ] **5.** Sonic tanks need proper animations for the sonic wave projectile. #12289
- [x] **6.** Sandworms need proper animations for the worm movement.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/9781199-d2k-visual-polish?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Faction logo is visible in the radar bin on wide/tall maps
data.body:
Took me a while to figure out what is wrong with the minimap here:
![](http://img.prntscr.com/img?url=http://i.imgur.com/UNRLGJJ.png)

Then I realized it's the Atreides logo, which the map can't cover completely, so it's showing.
Related to #7384 and #7456.

Might be worth checking the other mods as well?

data.title: Use 3rd damage level of TS buildings for death instead of critical
Skip visibility updates when fog & shroud are disabled via lobby
data.body: Added a check whether both shroud and fog are disabled for a player, and if they are, completely skip visibility update for that player. Fixes #7669.

data.title: PlayerStatistics update is a performance hog
data.body: Even just me without any other AI or player, the occasional `PlayerStatistics` update in skirmish takes ~23 ms, causing a short, but noticable lag spike. Appears to be related to render.

data.title: Pathfinding in three dimensions
data.body: What if pathfinding considered all three axes while finding a path to destination? This would allow helicopters to fly above or below other aircraft. They could have a cruising altitude, a minimum altitude and a maximum altitude. And they could change altitude within that range to fly around other aircraft?

data.title: Fix archive extraction in appveyor builds
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7667

data.title: Black screen Windows 8.1
data.body:
Hi guys

When I start up OpenRA I am presented with a black screen. The mouse cursor does change to the OpenRA cursor however.

I have tried running this in compatibility mode and as administrator but still no luck.
Also I have updated my latest intel HD graphics drivers.

I am running Windows 8.1 on a Lenovo T540p notebook with the following specs:
Intel Core i7-4710MQ (2.5 GHz x 8)
16GB RAM

data.title: Allow the use of race variants in "StartGameNotification:"
data.body: Needed for ra2, as there are two different notifications (allied and soviet).

data.title: Support per-mod hotkeys
data.body:
Different mods may want different hotkeys for mod-specific stuff.
Example is the production tabs, as shown in #7541.
This would include mostly having a different Input tab in the Settings menu, I assume.

data.title: Money cheat for all players and AI
data.body: This is a quick way to give cash to all the players and AI in the game. Useful for debugging/speed up bot activity. Won't affect the 'all' cheat.

data.title: Where is "left click order" in playtest-20150118
data.body: Didn't find it in the settings menu.

data.title: AI MCV deployment decisions
data.body:
Just another AI issue. Probably a duplicate of something.

I was just testing something, minding my own business, when suddenly, a wild MCV appeared!
I sometimes disable the AI player when testing unrelated stuff, sometime I just leave it.
So the MCV just came to my base and decided to undeploy:
![](http://i.imgur.com/I4xYeR6.png)

This is where the AI's base should be:
I assume the crate got in the way and the MCV couldn't unpack, so it decided to come to my patch of rock, for some reason...
![](http://i.imgur.com/qtQMtmi.png)

It would have been easier to just depend on `libnewtonsoft-json5.0-cil`, but that is only available in Ubuntu 14.04 and higher.

data.title: More constructor caching and minor random optimisations
data.body:
Moved many trait look-ups from Tick (or other actions) to constructors.
Performance gains are likely negligible, but this also makes the affected code more consistent with traits and activities where this had already been done.
Additionally extracted `FlyOffMap` and `HarvestResource` activities into their own files, and moved harvesting-related activities into their own subfolder.

A couple of notes:
- There are a few more cases (aircraft attack activities and `Repariable` trait, for example) which I intentionally omitted since they're already part of #7324.
- I also omitted `FindResources` for now, because I had trouble dealing with that 'double'-constructor, my attempts compiled fine but crashed the game at launch. Feel free to make suggestions on how to deal with those constructors.

data.title: release 20141029 crashes after 5 minutes of playing a game
data.body:
OS: Debian Testing 64 bit 

Hardware: sony vaio pro 13, hd 4400 gpu

DE: Happens in both Gnome and KDE 

Reelease: openra_release.20141029_all.deb

Launching from the terminal started OpenRa fine however after 5 mins of a local skirmish match it crashed. This happened 3-4 times in Gnome so I switched to KDE to see if it happened there .

data.title: RevealsShroud trait active even when shroud/fog are disabled
data.body:
In a test game with over 100 yaks and migs where I had disabled fog/shroud in map options - and later per cheat as well, to be sure - `RevealsShroud` was the only thing that continously ate over 1 or 2 ms according to perf.log.

Disabling this trait when both fog and shroud are disabled might help performance a little in games/maps where this is the case.
